intro: Arracacia brandegeei var. sylvatica, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its invasive nature in some regions, it is sometimes considered a weed.
